title: Use Power BI to create reports via OData
content:
Use case

Your organization wants to create a report that reflects the number of articles distributed in various services.

To create the report in Power BI, take the following steps:

Connect to the OData feed

  1. Open Power BI Desktop. In the Home page, select Get data > OData feed.

  2. In the OData feed window, input your OData feed URL in the URL field, and click OK.
    https://<Service Management host name>:<port number>/datahub/<tenant ID>/odata/ or https://<Service Management host name>:<port number>/datahub/<tenant ID>/odata

  3. Power BI Desktop prompts you to enter your credentials. Select Basic and input your user name and password, and then click Save. See Authentication method for detailed information.
  4. Now you can connect to the Service Management data. Power BI Desktop displays the available tables and other data elements in the Navigator window.

Sort out the data

To create a report that reflects the number of articles distributed in various services, you need to import and sort out the data of Article and ServiceDefinition.

  1. Select Article and ServiceDefinition from the Navigator list, and then click Load.
  2. After you select Load, Power BI Desktop imports the data, and may display a Load window of the import progress.
  3. Once complete, Power BI Desktop displays the available data in the Fields side panel.

  4. Expand the Article file, and then select the Id and Service fields, which are required for creating this report.

  5. Now you can see a table displayed in the UI, because the Table type is selected by default in the Visualizations panel.
     

  6. Go to Modeling > Manage relationships. You can see the relationship between Article and ServiceDefinition detected by the system.

  7. Based on the relationship between Article and ServiceDefinition, we can show the display name of Service in the report:
    Close the Manage relationships window opened in the previous step.
    Expand the ServiceDefinition file, and then select the DisplayLabel field. Now the display name of Service is also shown in the table:

  8. In order to show the total number of Articles for a particular Service, you can count the number of the Id records, because Id is the unique key of an Article record.
    To do this, select the Id field under Columns, and then select Count (Distinct) from the popup menu.

    Now the table is shown as below:

  9. Because we already have the display name of Service in the table, we can now remove the Service column (Id of Service) from the table by unchecking the Service field under the Article file.
    After this, the table is shown as below:

Create the report

Next, we can convert the data of the table above into a chart report:

  1. Select the entire table. You can see the focus indicators when the whole table is selected. Then, select Pie chart under the Visualizations panel.

    Now the table is converted into a pie chart.
  2. You may notice that some of the the labels on the chart aren't clear and easy to understand. We can rename them in the Visualizations panel:
    Select DisplayLabel under Legend, and then select Rename for this visual. You may rename the label as Service.
  3. Similarly, you may rename the label of Count of Id as Number of Articles.
    Now the chart is shown as below.

Refresh the data

When the data are updated in Service Management, you need to refresh the data in Power BI to synchronize the changes:

For each file, select More options and then select Refresh data. The chart will be refreshed accordingly.
